alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued January 07 at 2:43AM EST until January 08 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with locally higher possible. * WHERE...Northern Erie and Southern Erie counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow looks to occur through the morning then bands of locally heavy lake effect snow will persist through the day. Experimental content below...do not use operationally. To view the experimental polygons please see: http://www.weather.gov/buf/lespolygon COORD...4201 7976 4227 7975 4220 7991 4215 8009 4192 8051 4185 8052 4184 8031 4185 7994 4193 7984 4196 7970 TIME Y22M01D07T0800Z-Y22M01D08T0600Z
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
